column1: 2 ^ O God
column2: we have heard with our ears~; our fathers have declared to us
column3: the work thou hast wrought in their days
column4: and in the days of old.

column1: 3 ^ Thy hand destroyed the Gentiles and thou plantedst them~; thou didst afflict the people and cast them out~;
4 ^ for not by their own sword did they inherit the land
column2: and their own arm did not save them~; rather thy right hand and thy arm
column3: and the light of thy countenance
column4: because thou wast pleased with them.

column1: 5 ^ Thou art thyself my king and my God
column2: who commandest the saving for Jacob.

column1: 6 ^ Through thee we will push down our enemies with the horn
column2: and through thy name we will despise them that rise up against us.

column1: 7 ^ For I will not trust in my bow
column2: and my sword shall not save me.

column1: 8 ^ But thou hast saved us from them that afflict us
column2: and hast put them to shame that hate us.

column1: 9 ^ In God shall we glory all the day long
column2: and in thy name we will give praise for ever.

column1: 10 ^ But now thou hast cast us off
column5: wilt not go out with our armies.

column1: 11 ^ Thou hast made us turn our back to our enemies
column2: and they that hated us plundered for themselves.

column1: 12 ^ Thou hast given us up like sheep to be eaten
column2: and thou hast scattered us among the nations.

column1: 13 ^ Thou hast sold thy people for no price
column2: and there was no reckoning in the exchange of them.

column1: 14 ^ Thou hast made us a reproach to our neighbours~; a scoff and derision to them that are round about us.
15 ^ Thou hast made us a byword among the Gentiles~; a shaking of the head among the people.
16 ^ All the day long my shame is before me
column2: and the confusion of my face hath covered me

column1: 17 ^ at the voice of him that reproacheth and detracteth me~; at the face of the enemy and persecutor.
18 ^ All these things have come upon us
column2: yet we have not forgotten thee
column3: and we have not done wickedly in thy covenant.

column1: 19 ^ And our heart hath not turned back
column2: and thou hast diverted our steps from thy way

column1: 20 ^ for thou hast humbled us in the place of affliction
column2: and the shadow of death hath covered us.

column1: 21 ^ If we have forgotten the name of our God
column2: and if we have spread forth our hands to a strange god

column1: 22 ^ shall not God search out these things~? For he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
23 ^ Because for thy sake we are killed all the day long~; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
24 ^ Arise~; why sleepest thou
column2: O Lord~? Arise and cast us not off to the end.

column1: 25 ^ Why turnest thou thy face away~? Why forgettest our want and our trouble~?
26 ^ For our soul is humbled down to the dust~; our belly cleaveth to the earth.
27 ^ Arise
column4: and redeem us for thy name's sake.
